oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lookout Mountain War Relic Museum

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Plaques; Rifles
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Lookout Mountain (Tenn.); Grant, Ulysses S. (Ulysses Simpson), 1822-1885; Thomas, George Henry, 1816-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Part of the collection in the War Relic Museum at Lookout Mountain. Featured in the image are cannonballs, rifles, and various other military relics. Printed text on the card reads "I am sitting in General Grant's chair that he used at Orchard Knob in 1863 and am writing on General Thomas' table that he used at Chickamauga now in the Lookout Mountain War Relic Museum."
The Lookout Mountain War Relic Museum was run By W. E. Hardison. Postcards describing the museum's collections were quite popular.
